DataElement.preferredName: Patient Endometrial Malignant Neoplasm Treatment Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients based therapy for an atypical neoplastic relating to or composed of endometrium.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Endometrial Malignant Neoplasm Treatment Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients based therapy for an atypical neoplastic relating to or composed of endometrium.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Endometrial Malignant Neoplasm Therapy Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to or composed of endometrium.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or composed of endometrium.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient received any
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any targeted therapy (including, but not limited to vaccines, antibodies or tyrosine kinase inhibitors) or hormonal therapy for management of their ovarian, Fallopian tube or peritoneal primary carcinoma

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any non-surgical therapy for endometrial cancer including chemotherapy, radiation (including pre- or post-operative brachytherapy), hormonal or biologic therapy
